      6a
      Solid-state reactivity and structural transformations involving coordination polymers
      Kole, Goutam Kumar; Vittal, Jagadese J.
      Chemical Society Reviews (2013), 42 (4), 1755-1775CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A review. This tutorial review discusses recent literature on coordination polymers and metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) that exhibit solid-state reactivity and structural transformation under various exptl. conditions. Removal or exchange of solvents and guest mols., exposure to reactive vapors, and external stimuli such as heat, light or mechanochem. force cause such structural transformations and these are often manifested by various phys. properties such as color, magnetism, luminescence, chirality, porosity, etc. due to change in coordination no. and geometry, dimensionality, interpenetration, etc. More drastic transformations related to the exchange of metal ions, pillar ligands and insertion of addnl. ligands between the layers also were demonstrated. The vast area of dynamic behavior of coordination polymers and their stimuli-responsive properties also were addressed briefly.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhsV2kuro%253D&md5=91fae4fb685a46e2a6fd3a76b3891515
      (b) Sun, C.-Y.; Wang, X.-L.; Qin, C.; Jin, J.-L.; Su, Z.-M.; Huang, P.; Shao, K.-Z. Chem. - Eur. J. 2013, 19, 3639– 3645 DOI: 10.1002/chem.201203080
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      6b
      Solvatochromic Behavior of Chiral Mesoporous Metal-Organic Frameworks and Their Applications for Sensing Small Molecules and Separating Cationic Dyes
      Sun, Chun-Yi; Wang, Xin-Long; Qin, Chao; Jin, Jun-Ling; Su, Zhong-Min; Huang, Peng; Shao, Kui-Zhan
      Chemistry - A European Journal (2013), 19 (11), 3639-3645CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Two anionic metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) with 1-dimensional mesoporous tubes (1) and chiral mesoporous cages (2) were rationally constructed by a predesigned size-extended hexatopic ligand, namely, 5,5',5''-(1,3,5-triazine-2,4,6-triyl)tris(azanediyl)triisophthalate (TATAT). Charge neutrality is achieved by protonated dimethylamine cations. Notably, the two MOFs can be used to sep. large mols. based on ionic selectivity rather than the size-exclusion effect so far reported in the literature. Owing to the imino triazine backbone and carboxyl groups of the hexatopic ligand, which provide important host-guest interactions, rare solvatochromic phenomena of 1 and 2 are obsd. on incorporating acetone and ethanol guests. Also, guest-dependent luminescence properties of compd. 2 were studied, and luminescence intensity is significantly enhanced in toluene and benzene, while quenching effects are obsd. in acetone and ethanol. Thus, compd. 2 may be a potential material for luminescent probes.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhslWrsrY%253D&md5=e77d279486094c6fd54ea869fce702cf
      (c) Yi, F.-Y.; Yang, W.; Sun, Z.-M. J. Mater. Chem. 2012, 22, 23201– 23209 DOI: 10.1039/c2jm35273g
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      6c
      Highly selective acetone fluorescent sensors based on microporous Cd(II) metal-organic frameworks
      Yi, Fei-Yan; Yang, Weiting; Sun, Zhong-Ming
      Journal of Materials Chemistry (2012), 22 (43), 23201-23209CODEN: JMACEP; ISSN:0959-9428. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Solvothermal reaction of Cd2+ ions and a hexavalent carboxylic acid (H6L, I) afforded a Cd(II) metal org. framework (Cd-MOF), {[Cd3(L)(H2O)2(DMF)2]·5DMF}n (1). Its structure consists of trinuclear CdII building units, which are further bridged by the carboxylic ligand, resulting in a 4,4-connected topol. net (sra). By introducing a rigid N-donor ligand 1,4-bis(1-imidazolyl)benzene (dib), a new Cd-MOF (2) {[Cd3(L)(dib)]·3H2O·5DMA}n was isolated, in which the coordinated sites of solvent mols. in 1 were completely replaced by dib. The resulting trinuclear Cd3 subunits are further bridged into a 2-fold interpenetrating network with DMA and water mols. located in the void space. The luminescent properties of the two microporous Cd-MOFs dispersed in different solvents were studied systematically, demonstrating unique selectivity for the detection of acetone via a fluorescence quenching mechanism. Their luminescence intensities decreased to 50% at an acetone content of 0.3 vol.% and were almost completely quenched at a concn. of 1.0 vol.%, thus, they can be considered as excellent potential luminescent probes for the detection of acetone.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XhsFSqtLzK&md5=746de7d9b2dd374e83b5160035ad19e1
      (d) Chen, B. L.; Xiang, S. C.; Qian, G. D. Acc. Chem. Res. 2010, 43, 1115– 1124 DOI: 10.1021/ar100023y
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      6d
      Metal-Organic Frameworks with Functional Pores for Recognition of Small Molecules
      Chen, Banglin; Xiang, Shengchang; Qian, Guodong
      Accounts of Chemical Research (2010), 43 (8), 1115-1124CODEN: ACHRE4; ISSN:0001-4842. (American Chemical Society)
      A review. Mol. recognition, an important process in biol. and chem. systems, governs the diverse functions of a variety of enzymes and unique properties of some synthetic receptors. Because mol. recognition is based on weak interactions between receptors and substrates, the design and assembly of synthetic receptors to mimic biol. systems and the development of novel materials to discriminate different substrates for selective recognition of specific mols. has proved challenging. The extensive research on synthetic receptors for mol. recognition, particularly on noncovalent complexes self-assembled by hydrogen bonding and metal-org. coordination, has revealed some underlying principles. In particular, these studies have demonstrated that the shapes of the supramol. receptors play significant roles in their specific and selective recognition of substrates: receptors can offer concave surfaces that complement their convex targets. This Account describes our research to develop a synthetic mol. recognition platform using porous metal-org. frameworks (MOFs). These materials contain functional pores to direct their specific and unique recognition of small mols. through several types of interactions: van der Waals interactions of the framework surface with the substrate, metal-substrate interactions, and hydrogen bonding of the framework surface with the substrate. These materials have potential applications for gas storage, sepn., and sensing. We demonstrate a simple strategy to construct a primitive cubic net of interpenetrated microporous MOFs from the self-assembly of the paddle-wheel clusters M2(CO2)4 (M = Cu2+, Zn2+, and Co2+) with two types of org. dicarboxylic acid and pillar bidentate linkers. This efficient method allows us to rationally tune the micropores to size-exclusively sort different small gas mols., leading to the highly selective sepn. and purifn. of gases. By optimizing the strong interactions between open metal sites within porous MOFs and gas mols. such as hydrogen and acetylene, we have developed several MOF materials with extraordinary acetylene storage capacity at room temp. We have also immobilized Lewis acidic and basic sites into luminescent porous MOFs to recognize and sense neutral and ionic species. Using the strategy to systematically immobilize different open metal sites within porous MOFs from the metallo-ligand precursors, we have developed the first microporous mixed-metal-org. framework (M'MOF) with enhanced affinity for hydrogen mols., which successfully sepd. D2 from H2 using kinetic isotope quantum mol. sieving. Because we can functionalize the pores to direct their specific recognition of small mols., the emerging porous MOFs serve as novel functional materials for gas storage, sepn., heterogeneous catalysis, and sensing.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXlslyhtrs%253D&md5=f9230905a5656f9fe0e487967ecae356
      (e) Cui, Y. J.; Yue, Y. F.; Qian, G. D.; Chen, B. L. Chem. Rev. 2012, 112, 1126– 1162 DOI: 10.1021/cr200101d
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar

      A review. The authors discuss the title topic and applications such as LEDs and luminescent sensors.

      (a) Ockwig, N. W.; Delgado-Friedrichs, O.; O’Keeffe, M.; Yaghi, O. M. Acc. Chem. Res. 2005, 38, 176– 182 DOI: 10.1021/ar020022l
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      7a
      Reticular Chemistry: Occurrence and Taxonomy of Nets and Grammar for the Design of Frameworks
      Ockwig, Nathan W.; Delgado-Friedrichs, Olaf; O'Keeffe, Michael; Yaghi, Omar M.
      Accounts of Chemical Research (2005), 38 (3), 176-182CODEN: ACHRE4; ISSN:0001-4842. (American Chemical Society)
      The structures of all 1127 three-periodic extended metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) reported in the Cambridge Structure Database were analyzed, and their underlying topol. was detd. It is remarkable that among the almost infinite no. of net topologies that are available for MOFs to adopt, only a handful of nets are actually obsd. The discovery of this inversion between expected and obsd. nets led the authors to deduce a system of classification taxonomy for interpreting and rationalizing known MOF structures, as well as those that will be made in future. The origin of this inversion is attributed to the different modes with which MOF synthesis was approached. Specifically, three levels of complexity are defined that embody rules grammar for the design of MOFs and other extended structures. This system accounts for the present proliferation of MOF structures of high symmetry nets, but more importantly, it provides the basis for designing a building block that codes for a specific structure and, indeed, only that structure.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXksFSgsg%253D%253D&md5=13530d98a4733672738db281372887ae
      (b) Carlucci, L.; Ciani, G.; Proserpio, D. M. Coord. Chem. Rev. 2003, 246, 247– 289 DOI: 10.1016/S0010-8545(03)00126-7
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      7b
      Polycatenation, polythreading and polyknotting in coordination network chemistry
      Carlucci, Lucia; Ciani, Gianfranco; Proserpio, Davide M.
      Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2003), 246 (1-2), 247-289CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier Science B.V.)
      A review is presented on polycatenation, polythreading and polyknotting in coordination network chem. The use of crystal engineering concepts produced a variety of coordination networks, many of which exhibit novel and fascinating types of entanglements of individual motifs. This review analyses the structures of a no. of entangled polymeric networks reported in these years by many groups. A topol. classification of the different interlocked and interweaved species is attempted. Wide classes of polycatenated and polythreaded species were recognized and other phenomena, as polyknotting (self-penetration) and interweaving of 1-dimensional chains, are also discussed. Unexpected topol. features and new linkages, that were previously overviewed, were discovered, including the first examples of infinite Borromean links.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXpt1Gitr0%253D&md5=5727cc4be054c01d955b47f3cd366bc5

      8a
      Hydrothermal synthesis, structure and luminescent properties of one-dimensional lanthanide benzenedicarboxylates, [M(NO3)M2(C12H8N2)2][(C8H4O4)4]·H2O, (M = La, Pr), possessing infinite M-O-M linkages
      Thirumurugan, A.; Natarajan, Srinivasan
      Journal of Materials Chemistry (2005), 15 (43), 4588-4594CODEN: JMACEP; ISSN:0959-9428. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A hydrothermal reaction of a mixt. of M(NO3)3, 1,2-dicyanobenzene, 1,2-benzenedicarboxylic acid (1,2-BDC), 1,10-phenanthroline and piperazine gave rise to a new compd., [M(NO3)M2(C12H8N2)2][(C8H4O4)4]·H2O, (M = La, I and Pr, II). The structure is built up from the connectivity of MOn polyhedra by sharing an edge or face. The metal atoms are coordinated by 1,10-phenanthroline or nitrate groups along with the phthalates resulting in an infinite 1-dimensional M-O-M chain. The crystal structure is stabilized by π···π and CH···π interactions. The authors' preliminary studies of the Eu3+/Tb3+ doped samples (in place of La3+), indicate that interesting red/pink or green luminescence can obtained by excitation at 252 nm. The luminescence behavior probably results from the ligand-sensitized metal-centered emission.

      Open-framework nickel succinate, [Ni7(C4H4O4)6(OH)2(H2O)2]·2H2O: a new hybrid material with three-dimensional Ni-O-Ni connectivity
      Forster, Paul M.; Cheetham, Anthony K.
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2002), 41 (3), 457-459CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      A cryst. open-framework nickel succinate , [Ni7L6(OH)2(H2O)2]·2H2O, was prepd. using a biphasic (cyclohexanol/water) system. The crystal structure was detd. showing the structure to consist of layers of edge-sharing NiO6 octahedra forming rings connected by isolated corner sharing NiO6 octahedra creating unidimensional pores lined by methylene groups of the succinate. The nickel succinate was further characterized by thermal anal. and magnetic susceptibility measurements.

      The zero-dimensional metal carboxylate (C4N2H12)3[Zn2(C2O4)5]·8H2O (C4N2H12 = diprotonated piperazine) is shown to transform into higher-dimensional structures including the helical (C4N2H12)2[Zn2(C2O4)4]·3H2O (2), the honeycomb-like (C4N2H12)3[Zn2(C2O4)7]·4H2O (3) and the three-dimensional network structure of (C4N2H12)[Zn2(C2O4)3] (4), thereby indicating the presence of a progressive building-up process. Also obtained from NiO and propionic acid are the dimer [Ni(CH3CH2CO2)2(H2O)] (5) and the one-dimensional chain structure [Ni(CH3CH2CO2)2] (6). The mol. structures of 2-6 were detd. by X-ray crystallog.

      8e
      Hydrogen Sorption in Functionalized Metal-Organic Frameworks
      Rowsell, Jesse L. C.; Millward, Andrew R.; Park, Kyo Sung; Yaghi, Omar M.
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2004), 126 (18), 5666-5667CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      Five porous metal-org. frameworks based on linking zinc oxide clusters with benzene-1,4-dicarboxylate, naphthalene-2,6-dicarboxylate, 4,5,9,10-tetrahydropyrene-2,7-dicarboxylate, 2,3,5,6-tetramethylbenzene-1,4-dicarboxylate, or benzene-1,3,5-tris(4-benzoate) were synthesized in gram-scale quantities to measure their hydrogen uptake properties. Hydrogen adsorption isotherms measured at 77 K show a distinct dependence of uptake on the nature of the link. At 1 atm, the materials sorb between 4.2 and 9.3 mols. of H2 per formula unit. The results imply a trend in hydrogen uptake with the no. of rings in the org. moiety.

      Metal-oxygen-metal arrays in lamellar hybrid materials: Cobalt and manganese 4-cyclohexene-1,2-dicarboxylates
      Kim, Dae Sung; Forster, Paul M.; Diaz de Delgado, Graciela; Park, Sang-Eon; Cheetham, Anthony K.
      Dalton Transactions (2004), (20), 3365-3369CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The authors have obtained three layered hybrid materials from the hydrothermal reaction of 4-cyclohexene-1,2-dicarboxylic acid with Co and Mn salts: Co(C8H8O4) (1), Mn(H2O)(C8H8O4) (2), and Mn4(H2O)(C8H8O4)4·0.3H2O (3). The structures for all materials were solved by single-crystal XRD ((1) P‾1, a 4.805(2), b 6.650(3), c 12.960(6) Å, α 98.285(7), β 98.986(7), γ 95.689(7)°, V = 401.6(3) Å3, R1 = 0.0438; (2) P21/c, a 11.151(2), b 11.330(2), c 7.6560(15) Å, β 108.813(3)° , V = 915.6(3) Å3, R1 = 0.0412; (3) P‾1, a 11.412(3), b 12.136(4), c 13.809(4) Å, α 104.703(6), β 103.207(6), γ 92.468(5)°, V = 1790.6(9) Å3, R1 = 0.1056). While all three structures are two-dimensional overall, the metal-oxygen-metal dimensionality within the layers varies from isolated metal atoms in the case of complex 1 to 1-dimensional ribbons of vertex sharing MnO6 octahedra in complex 2 and 2-dimensional arrays of edge- and vertex-sharing polyhedra in complex 3. Variable temp. magnetic susceptibility measurements were obtained for complex 2 and its magnetic properties are discussed.

      9
      Structural diversity and chemical trends in hybrid inorganic-organic framework materials
      Cheetham, Anthony K.; Rao, C. N. R.; Feller, Russell K.
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2006), (46), 4780-4795CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A review. Hybrid framework compds., including both metal-org. coordination polymers and systems that contain extended inorg. connectivity (extended inorg. hybrids), have recently developed into an important new class of solid-state materials. The authors examine the diversity of this complex class of materials, propose a simple but systematic classification, and explore the chem. and geometrical factors that influence their formation. The authors also discuss the growing evidence that many hybrid frameworks tend to form under thermodn. rather than kinetic control when the synthesis is carried out under hydrothermal conditions. Finally, the authors explore the potential applications of hybrid frameworks in areas such as gas sepns. and storage, heterogeneous catalysis, and photoluminescence.

      (a) Rao, K. P.; Thirumurugan, A.; Rao, C. N. R. Chem. - Eur. J. 2007, 13, 3193– 3201 DOI: 10.1002/chem.200600966
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10a
      Lamellar and three-dimensional hybrid compounds formed by cyclohexene- and cyclohexanedicarboxylates of Pb, La, and Cd
      Rao, K. Prabhakara; Thirumurugan, A.; Rao, C. N. R.
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2007), 13 (11), 3193-3201CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      To establish factors that det. the formation of three-dimensional hybrid structures of metal dicarboxylates involving metal-O-metal linkages, the authors have studied metal dicarboxylates derived from 1,2-cyclohexenedicarboxylate as well as 1,2-, 1,3-, and 1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acids. Thus, the authors synthesized a 1,2-cyclohexenedicarboxylate of Cd, [Cd(1,2-CHeDC)(H2O)] (I), a 1,2-cyclohexanedicarboxylate of Pb, [Pb(1,2-CHDC)] (II), and three 1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylates of La [La2(1,4-CHDC)3(H2O)4] (III), [La3(1,4-HCHDC)2(1,4-CHDC)5(H2O)2]·H2O (IV) and [La2(1,4-CHDC)3(H2O)]·2.5H2O (V) under hydrothermal conditions and detd. their structures. A mixed dicarboxylate involving both 1,3- and 1,4-cyclohexenedicarboxylates of Pb, [Pb3O(1,3-CHDC)(1,4-CHDC)]·0.5H2O (VI) and a 1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylate of Pb, [Pb6O2(1,4-CHDC)3(1,4-HCHDC)2], also were synthesized and characterized. While the 1,2-dicarboxylates have layered structures, the 1,4-dicarboxylates and the mixed dicarboxylates possess three-dimensional structures. Both the 1,2- and 1,4-dicarboxylates are true hybrid compds. composed of infinite M-O-M linkages. The equatorial-equatorial (e,e) conformation is adopted commonly in all these compds., although less stable conformations are encountered occasionally. The formation of the layered and the three-dimensional structures can be understood based on the relative disposition of the two carboxylic groups, the 1,4-isomer favoring the three-dimensional structure. Based on the results of the present study along with the available literature, to obtain three-dimensional hybrid structures with metal-O-metal networks, it appears necessary to make use of the 1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXks1Smuro%253D&md5=74e9505cefd362f345ccf2ae374baa97
      (b) Thirumurugan, A.; Sanguramath, R. A.; Rao, C. N. R. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 823– 831 DOI: 10.1021/ic701323q
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10b
      Hybrid Structures Formed by Lead 1,3-Cyclohexanedicarboxylates
      Thirumurugan, A.; Sanguramath, R. A.; Rao, C. N. R.
      Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2008), 47 (3), 823-831CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      By the employment of hydrothermal methods, four lead 1,3-cyclohexanedicarboxylates Pb(1,3-CHDC)(H2O) (I), [(OPb4)2(OH)2(C2O4)(1,3-CHDC)4]·H2O (II), Pb2(1,3-CHDC)2(H2O) (III), and (OPb3)(1,3-CHDC)2 (IV), were prepd. and characterized. Of these, I and II have layered structures while III and IV have three-dimensional structures. I-III are hybrid structures possessing extended inorg. connectivity in one or two-dimensions (In, n = 1 or 2) involving infinite Pb-O-Pb linkages along with zero or 1-dimensional org. connectivity (Om, m = 0 or 1). I contains two types of layers with different connectivities (I1O1 and I2O0). III is a truly 3-dimensional hybrid compd. with I2O1 type connectivity. IV has three-dimensional org. connectivity (O3) but no inorg. connectivity (I0). The conformation of the CHDC anion is e,e in I-III and a,e in IV. In all these compds., the lead atom has hemi- or holodirected coordination geometry.

      10c
      1,2-, 1,3- And 1,4-benzenedicarboxylates of Cd and Zn of different dimensionalities: Process of formation of the three-dimensional structure
      Thirumurugan, A.; Rao, C. N. R.
      Journal of Materials Chemistry (2005), 15 (35-36), 3852-3858CODEN: JMACEP; ISSN:0959-9428. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A systematic study of the benzenedicarboxylates (BDCs) formed by Cd and Zn with the three isomeric dicarboxylic acids in the presence or absence of amines was carried out. Several BDCs were prepd. under hydrothermal conditions and their structures established by x-ray crystallog. It is pointed out that the formation of the three-dimensional structures is most favored in the case of 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid. An example of a Zn 1,4-BDC where the three-dimensional structure is formed favorably with the increase in reaction temp. is discussed. A 1-dimensional chain structure is shown to transform to a three-dimensional structure as a function of time at an appropriate temp.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXpsFeisLo%253D&md5=386387b05dfd50b5a16dec37d8d66907
      (d) Dan, M.; Rao, C. N. R. Chem. - Eur. J. 2005, 11, 7102– 7109 DOI: 10.1002/chem.200500922
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10d
      Metal aminocarboxylate coordination polymers with chain and layered structures
      Dan, Meenakshi; Rao, C. N. R.
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2005), 11 (23), 7102-7109CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      The synthesis and structures of metal aminocarboxylates prepd. in acidic, neutral, or alk. media were explored with the purpose of isolating coordination polymers with linear chain and two-dimensional layered structures. Metal glycinates [CoCl2(H2O)2(CO2CH2NH3)] (I), [MnCl2(CO2CH2NH3)2] (II), and [Cd3Cl6(CO2CH2NH3)4] (III) with 1-dimensional chain structures were obtained by the reaction of the metal salts with glycine in acidic medium under hydro/solvothermal conditions. These chain compds. contain glycine in the zwitterionic form. 4-Aminobutyric acid transforms to a cyclic amide under such reaction conditions, and the amide forms a chain compd. [CdBr2L] (IV; L = cyclobutamide). Glycine in the zwitterionic form also forms a two-dimensional layered compd. [Mn(H2O)2(CO2CH2NH3)2]Br2 (V). 6-Aminocaproic acid under alk. conditions forms layered compds. with metals at room temp., the metal being coordinated both by the amino N and the carboxyl O atoms. Of the two layered compds. [Cd{CO2(CH2)5NH2}2]·2H2O (VI) and [Cu{CO2(CH2)5NH2}2]·2H2O (VII), the latter has voids in which H2O mols. reside.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXht1yksbrN&md5=457b115a469eef59588e84db73158d67

      An Alkaline Earth I3O0 Porous Coordination Polymer: [Ba2TMA(NO3)(DMF)]
      Foo, Maw Lin; Horike, Satoshi; Inubushi, Yasutaka; Kitagawa, Susumu
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2012), 51 (25), 6107-6111, S6107/1-S6107/11CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      The the synthesis of [Ba2TMA(NO3)(DMF)]·DMF ([1(DMF)]DMF), an alk. earth I3O0 porous coordination polymer (PCP) framework constructed from trimesic acid (H3TMA = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid) is reported. Framework 1 has three-dimensional Ba-O-Ba bonding with 1-dimensional channels decorated by protruding O atoms. The thermal stability of [1(DMF)]DMF was detd. and the porosity of the acetone exchanged [1(acetone)] was demonstrated by N2 gas adsorption measurements. Also, CO2 and CH4 gas adsorption measurements were undertaken to examine the ability of [1(acetone)] to sep. these two gases.

      Intraneuronal aluminum accumulation in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and parkinsonism-dementia of Guam
      Perl, Daniel P.; Gajdusek, D. Carleton; Garruto, Ralph M.; Yanagihara, Richard T.; Gibbs, Clarence J., Jr.
      Science (Washington, DC, United States) (1982), 217 (4564), 1053-5CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075.
      SEM with energy-dispersive x-ray spectrometry was used to analyze the elemental content of neurofibrillary tangle (NFT)-bearing and NFT-free neurons within the Sommer's sector (H1 region) of the hippocampus in the Guam indigenous population (Chamorro) with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and parkinsonism-dementia and in neurol. normal controls. Preliminary data indicate prominent accumulation of Al within the nuclear region and perikaryal cytoplasm of NFT-bearing hippocampal neurons, regardless of the underlysing neurol. diagnosis. These findings further extend the assocn. between intraneuronal Al and NFT formation and support the hypothesis that environmental factors are related to the neurodegenerative changes seen in the Chamorro population.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaL38XlsVaksLw%253D&md5=7c2f4e9488f063040189436a14464f74

      13
      Alzheimer's disease: x-ray spectrometric evidence of aluminum accumulation in neurofibrillary tangle-bearing neurons
      Perl, Daniel P.; Brody, Arnold R.
      Science (Washington, DC, United States) (1980), 208 (4441), 297-9CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075.
      The elemental content of neurons of the hippocampus was studied in brain tissue from 3 cases of senile dementia (Alzheimer type) and 3 nondemented elderly controls. Focuses of Al were detected within the nuclear region of a high percentage of neurons contg. neurofibrillary tangles from the cases of senile dementia and from the elderly controls. The adjacent normal-appearing neurons from both groups of patients were virtually free of detectable Al. Apparently, the assocn. of Al to Alzheimer's disease extends to the neuronal level.

      14
      Aluminum and Alzheimer's disease: model studies
      Fasman, Gerald D.
      Coordination Chemistry Reviews (1996), 149 (), 125-165CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier)
      A review, with 124 refs. Model tangles, 13 amino acid sequences and 17 amino acid sequences (NF-M13, NF-M17) have been synthesized and phosphorylated. CD studies of their interaction with Ca2+ and Al3+ have demonstrated the formation of β-pleated sheets. The Ca2+ effect can be reversed with citric acid. By the study of synthetic mutants, it has been shown that Al3+ binds to COO-, OH of Ser and the PO3H of SerPO3H. The β-sheet formation caused by Al3+ can be reversed by silicates. βA4 was converted to β-sheets by Al3+, which was also reversed by the addn. of silicates. It was suggested that silicates be considered for therapeutic use to delay the onset of plaques and tangles in Alzheimer's disease.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      A tubular europium-organic framework exhibiting selective sensing of Fe3+ and Al3+ over mixed metal ions
      Chen, Zhen; Sun, Yanwen; Zhang, Liangliang; Sun, Di; Liu, Fuling; Meng, Qingguo; Wang, Rongming; Sun, Daofeng
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2013), 49 (98), 11557-11559CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A luminescent europium-org. framework, [H2NMe2][Eu(H2O)2(BTMIPA)]·2H2O, with tubular channels based on the H4BTMIPA ligand (H4BTMIPA = 5,5'-methylenebis(2,4,6-trimethylisophthalic acid)) was assembled and characterized crystallog. The [H2NMe2]+ ions as counterions are located in the channels. The cation exchange between [H2NMe2]+ and metal ions demonstrated that complex 1 can selectively sense Fe3+ and Al3+ ions through fluorescence quenching and enhancement, resp.

      16c
      Cationic inorganic materials for anionic pollutant trapping and catalysis
      Oliver, Scott R. J.
      Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (7), 1868-1881CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A review. Despite their vast industrial importance, almost all extended inorg. synthetic structures and naturally occurring minerals adopt a neutral or anionic charge. This tutorial review describes the current knowledge of inorg. materials that bear a pos. charge on the host. The best-known example is the family of clays known as layered double hydroxides (LDH's), and other limited examples also exist. The authors' research efforts gave rise to new cationic inorg. materials, oxides and fluorides of heavy p-block metals. Org.-based cationic materials will also be briefly discussed. Interest in these materials is widespread, with potential applications in many areas including anionic pollutant trapping, exchange, selective catalysis, polymer hybrids and nanocomposites, and biomaterials for drug or DNA delivery.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXns1SlsLY%253D&md5=ffb61643cfe8d7c45ff1666122603abf

      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      17a
      Simple colorimetric sensor for Cr(III) and Cr(VI) speciation using silver nanoparticles as a probe
      Elavarasi, M.; Rajeshwari, A.; Alex, Sruthi Ann; Nanda Kumar, D.; Chandrasekaran, N.; Mukherjee, Amitava
      Analytical Methods (2014), 6 (14), 5161-5167CODEN: AMNEGX; ISSN:1759-9679. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      In this study, we present a simple colorimetric probe for detecting chromium species, i.e. Cr(VI) and Cr(III), in aq. soln. using as-synthesized citrate-capped silver nanoparticles without further functionalization. Two types of silver nanoparticles, AgNP-I (10 mL sodium borohydride) and AgNP-II (30 mL sodium borohydride) were synthesized by varying the vol. of the reducing agent. AgNP-I was proven to be specific for Cr(III) only whereas AgNP-II would measure total chromium in a binary mixt. of Cr(III) and Cr(VI). The probe was tested in a binary mixt. at a 1 : 1 ratio, contg. the total chromium concns. in the range of 500-5000 ppb. The sensing method was also successfully applied in a portable colorimeter with similar binary combinations paving the way for further on-site applications.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2cXhtVKjsLnJ&md5=d26e145359ce117321736143fa54bde7
      (b) Liu, Y.; Wang, X. Anal. Methods 2013, 5, 1442– 1448 DOI: 10.1039/c3ay00016h
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      17b
      Colorimetric speciation of Cr(III) and Cr(VI) with a gold nanoparticle probe
      Liu, Yong; Wang, Xianxiang
      Analytical Methods (2013), 5 (6), 1442-1448CODEN: AMNEGX; ISSN:1759-9679. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Gold nanoparticles (AuNPs) have frequently been explored for colorimetric probes for metal ions, including Cr(III), but probes capable of speciation of chromium, i.e., detection of both Cr(III) and Cr(VI), are seldom reported. In this work, by taking advantage of the coordination between Cr(III) and citrate, as well as the ligand effect of citrate for prepn. and stabilization of AuNPs, a colorimetric probe for Cr(III) detection based on citrate-capped AuNPs is reported. Cr(VI) was also detected after redn. to Cr(III). Speciation anal. of Cr(III) and Cr(VI) was thus performed. The citrate-capped AuNPs exhibited excellent selectivity toward Cr(III) over other common metal ions. Limits of detection for Cr(III) were 4 μM and 0.3 μM with the naked eye and UV-vis spectroscopic detection, resp. The anal. performances for Cr(VI) were very much similar to those for Cr(III). The anal. potential of the proposed colorimetric speciation probe was evaluated for successful detection of Cr(III) and Cr(VI) in water samples, with spike-recoveries ranging from 96.7 to 106%.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      18b
      Chromium Speciation in Rainwater: Temporal Variability and Atmospheric Deposition
      Kieber, Robert J.; Willey, Joan D.; Zvalaren, Suzanne D.
      Environmental Science and Technology (2002), 36 (24), 5321-5327CODEN: ESTHAG; ISSN:0013-936X. (American Chemical Society)
      The concns. of the various chromium species were detd. in 89 rainwater samples collected in Wilmington, North Carolina, from Oct. 1, 1999, to Dec. 31, 2001. Vol.-weighted annual av. concns. of Crtotal, particulate Cr, Cr(III)(aq), and Cr(VI)(aq) were 4.6, 2.2, 0.8, and 1.2nM, resp. There was distinct seasonal and diurnal variability in the concns. of the various chromium species. Chromium emissions to the global atm. by both natural and anthropogenic sources are estd. to be 2.2 × 109 mol/yr. Using our rainwater concn. data along with other published rainwater Cr concns. and an est. for total global annual rain, the total global flux of chromium removed from the atm. via wet deposition is 2.1 × 109 mol/yr. This represents complete removal of Cr and indicates that essentially all chromium released into the global atm. is removed via rain. About half this chromium is dissolved, with roughly equal concns. of toxic Cr(VI) and relatively harmless Cr(III) species.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38XosFyiurs%253D&md5=240ac2c2ceff15231cdf05d707976d2c

      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      18c
      Adsorbent for chromium removal based on graphene oxide functionalized with magnetic cyclodextrin-chitosan
      Li, Leilei; Fan, Lulu; Sun, Min; Qiu, Huamin; Li, Xiangjun; Duan, Huimin; Luo, Chuannan
      Colloids and Surfaces, B: Biointerfaces (2013), 107 (), 76-83CODEN: CSBBEQ; ISSN:0927-7765. (Elsevier B.V.)
      A simple chem. bonding method to synthesize magnetic cyclodextrin-chitosan/graphene oxide (CCGO) was reported. The adsorption behaviors of Cr(VI) in aq. soln. on CCGO were systematically investigated. As the results shown that, with the advantage of high surface area, abundant hydroxyl and amino groups of CCGO, and the magnetic property of Fe3O4, the Cr(VI) can be easily and rapidly extd. from the water by magnetic attraction under investigation. The adsorption equil. of CCGO for Cr(VI) corresponded with Langmuir isotherm, and the novel adsorbent exhibited better Cr(VI) removal efficiency in solns. with low pH. It was found that the Cr(VI) adsorption performance of CCGO strongly depends on their surface charge concn. and sp. surface area. These results provide evidences for estg. and optimizing the removal of metal ions from the wastewater by using of CCGO composites in the future.

      (a) Qiu, B.; Xue, L. L.; Wu, Y. P.; Lin, Z. Y.; Guo, L. H.; Chen, G. N. Talanta 2011, 85, 339– 344 DOI: 10.1016/j.talanta.2011.03.063
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      19a
      Mechanism study on inorganic oxidants induced inhibition of Ru(bpy)32+ electrochemiluminescence and its application for sensitive determination of some inorganic oxidants
      Qiu, Bin; Xue, Lingling; Wu, Yanping; Lin, Zhenyu; Guo, Longhua; Chen, Guonan
      Talanta (2011), 85 (1), 339-344CODEN: TLNTA2; ISSN:0039-9140. (Elsevier B.V.)
      Inhibited Ru(bpy)3 2+ electrochemiluminescence by inorg. oxidants is studied. A no. of inorg. oxidants can quench the ECL of Ru(bpy)32+/tri-n-propylamine (TPrA) system, and the logarithm of the decrease in ECL intensity (ΔI) was proportional to the logarithm of analyte concns. Based on which, a sensitive approach for detection of these inorg. oxidants was established, e.g. the log-log plots of ΔI vs. the concn. of MnO4-, Cr2O72- and Fe(CN)63- are linear at 1 × 10-7 to 3 × 10-4 M for MnO4- and Cr2O72-, and 1 × 10-7 to 1 × 10-4 M for Fe(CN)63-, with the limit of detection (LOD) of 8.0 × 10-8 M, 2 × 10-8 M, and 1 × 10-8 M, resp. Expts. such as a comparison of the inhibitory effect of different compds. on Ru(bpy)32+/TPrA ECL, ECL emission spectra, UV-visible absorption spectra etc. were studied to discover how these inorg. analytes quench the ECL of Ru(bpy)32+/TPrA system. A mechanism based on consumption of TPrA intermediate (TPrA·) by inorg. oxidants was proposed.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      19b
      A novel permanganate-sensitive fluorescent nano-chemosensor assembled with a new 8-hydroxyquinoline-functionalized SBA-15
      Ganjali, Mohammad Reza; Gupta, Vinod Kumar; Hosseini, Morteza; Rafiei-Sarmazdeh, Zahra; Faridbod, Farnoush; Goldooz, Hassan; Badiei, Ali Reza; Norouzi, Parviz
      Talanta (2012), 88 (), 684-688CODEN: TLNTA2; ISSN:0039-9140. (Elsevier B.V.)
      A novel fluorescence nano-chemosensor for MnO4- anion was developed by assembly of fluorescent aluminum complex of 8-hydroxyquinoline (8-HQ) within the channels of modified SBA-15 (SBA-SPS-QAl). The ordered porous structure of SBA-15 is still retained after hybridization by chemosensor material. A remarkable fluorescent quenching of SBA-SPS-QAl was attributed to the effect of MnO4- anion. The linear detecting range of the hybrid mesoporous chemosensor is 0.16-4.6 μmol L-1 of MnO4 - anion and the lowest detection limit is 0.2 ng mL-1 in the aq. soln. SBA-SPS-QAl showed a selective and sensitive fluorescent quenching response toward MnO4- ion in comparison with N3 -, NO3-, CN-, HCO3-, Cl-, F-, H2PO4-, SO42-, Cr2O72-, IO3- and I- ions, which was because of the higher stability of its inorg. complex with permanganate anion.

      (a) Eddaoudi, M.; Li, H.-L.; Yaghi, O. M. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2000, 122, 1391– 1397 DOI: 10.1021/ja9933386

      20a
      Highly porous and stable metal-organic frameworks. Structure design and sorption properties
      Eddaoudi, Mohamed; Li, Hailian; Yaghi, O. M.
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2000), 122 (7), 1391-1397CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      Gas sorption isotherm measurements performed on the evacuated derivs. of 4 porous metal-org. frameworks (MOF-n), Zn(BDC).(DMF)(H2O) (DMF = N,N'-dimethylformamide, BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate) (MOF-2), Zn3(BDC)3.6CH3OH (MOF-3), Zn2(BTC)NO3.(C2H5OH)5H2O (BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate) (MOF-4), and Zn4O(BDC)3.(DMF)8C6H5Cl (MOF-5), reveal type I isotherms for n = 2, 3, and 5, which is evidence of microporous and accessible channels having high structural integrity and organization. Although gas sorption into MOF-4 was not obsd., careful examn. of its ethanol sorption isotherms at 22 and 32° point to the presence of coordinatively unsatd. Zn centers within its pores, which upon ethanol sorption undergo coordination transitions from 3- to 4-, 4- to 5-, and 5- to 6-coordination. MOF-n materials were produced by building the extended analogs of mol. metal carboxylate clusters, a strategy that has allowed the realization of the most porous and thermally stable framework yet reported: the evacuated form of MOF-5 is esp. stable in air at 300° and has a free pore vol. representing 55-60% of its crystal as detd. by gas sorption and single-crystal diffraction studies.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3cXotl2jsg%253D%253D&md5=bf52caa3fb6a6e160f205f938db8b3a7
      (b) Rosi, N. L.; Eckert, J.; Eddaoudi, M.; Vodak, D. T.; Kim, J.; O’Keeffe, M.; Yaghi, O. M. Science 2003, 300, 1127– 1129 DOI: 10.1126/science.1083440
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      20b
      Hydrogen Storage in Microporous Metal-Organic Frameworks
      Rosi, Nathaniel L.; Eckert, Juergen; Eddaoudi, Mohamed; Vodak, David T.; Kim, Jaheon; O'Keeffe, Michael; Yaghi, Omar M.
      Science (Washington, DC, United States) (2003), 300 (5622), 1127-1130CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075. (American Association for the Advancement of Science)
      Metal-org. framework-5 (MOF-5) Zn4O(BDC)3 (BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate) with a cubic three-dimensional extended porous structure adsorbed hydrogen up to 4.5 wt.% (17.2 hydrogen mols. per formula unit) at 78 K and 1.0 wt.% at room temp. and pressure of 20 bar. Inelastic neutron scattering spectroscopy of the rotational transitions of the adsorbed hydrogen mols. indicates two well-defined binding sites (termed I and II), which the authors assoc. with hydrogen binding to zinc and the BDC linker, resp. Preliminary studies on topol. similar isoreticular metal-org. framework-6 and -8 (IRMOF-6 and -8) having cyclobutylbenzene and naphthalene linkers, resp., gave approx. double and quadruple (2.0 wt.%) the uptake found for MOF-5 at room temp. and 10 bar.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      21a
      A chemically functionalizable nanoporous material [Cu3(TMA)2(H2O)3]n
      Chui, Stephen S.-Y.; Lo, Samuel M.-F.; Charmant, Jonathan P. H.; Orpen, A. Guy; Williams, Ian D.
      Science (Washington, D. C.) (1999), 283 (5405), 1148-1150CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075. (American Association for the Advancement of Science)
      Although zeolites and related materials combine nanoporosity with high thermal stability, they are difficult to modify or derivatize in a systematic way. A highly porous metal coordination polymer [Cu3(TMA)2(H2O)3]n (TMA is benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate) was formed in 80% yield. It has interconnected [Cu2(O2CR)4] units (R is an arom. ring), which create a three-dimensional system of channels with a pore size of 1 nm and an accessible porosity of ∼40% in the solid. Unlike zeolites, the channel linings can be chem. functionalized; for example, the aqua ligands can be replaced by pyridines. TGA and high-temp. single-crystal diffractometry indicate that the framework is stable up to 240°.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaK1MXhsFeitLc%253D&md5=8f6f372b015fa0e2bbb7e8bfd316b663
      (b) Devic, T.; Serre, C.; Audebrand, N.; Marrot, J.; Férey, G. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2005, 127, 12788– 12789 DOI: 10.1021/ja053992n
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      21b
      MIL-103, A 3-D Lanthanide-Based Metal Organic Framework with Large One-Dimensional Tunnels and A High Surface Area
      Devic, Thomas; Serre, Christian; Audebrand, Nathalie; Marrot, Jerome; Ferey, Gerard
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2005), 127 (37), 12788-12789CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      A lanthanide-based metal org. framework, formulated Tb(C27H15O6)(H2O)·2C6H11OH, was solvothermally synthesized using the extended rigid tritopic ligand 1,3,5-benzenetri-p-benzoic acid. Included free solvent could be removed upon heating, and the resulting material presents large 1-dimensional micropores (free diam. = 10 Å) and a high surface area (SLangmuir > 1000 m2 g-1).
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      22a
      Functional group effects on metal-organic framework topology
      Dau, Phuong V.; Tanabe, Kristine K.; Cohen, Seth M.
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2012), 48 (75), 9370-9372CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Functionalization of the ligand 1,3,5-tris(4-carboxyphenyl)benzene (H3BTB) was realized with methoxy (H3BTB-[OMe]3) and hydroxy (H3BTB-[OH]3) groups. Combining H3BTB-[OMe]3 and Zn(II) gave the first isostructural, functionalized analog of MOF-177 (MOF-177-OMe), while the combination of H3BTB-[OH]3 and Zn(II) generates a rare, interpenetrated pcu-e framework.

      22b
      Interwoven metal-organic framework on a periodic minimal surface with extra-large pores
      Chen, Banglin; Eddaoudi, M.; Hyde, S. T.; O'Keeffe, M.; Yaghi, O. M.
      Science (Washington, DC, United States) (2001), 291 (5506), 1021-1023CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075. (American Association for the Advancement of Science)
      A strategy for the design of highly porous and structurally stable networks makes use of metal-org. building blocks that can be assembled on a triply periodic P-minimal geometric surface to produce structures that are interpenetrating-more accurately considered as interwoven. The authors used 4,4',4''-benzene-1,3,5-triyltribenzoic acid (H3BTB), Cu(NO3)2e, and DMF to prep. Cu3(BTB)2(H2O)3·(DMF)9(H2O)2 (MOF-14), whose structure reveals a pair of interwoven metal-org. frameworks that are mutually reinforced. The structure contains remarkably large pores, 16.4 Å in diam., in which voluminous amts. of gases and org. solvents can be reversibly sorbed.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXhtFGlu7s%253D&md5=a9c2b80ba2f1b825ee2a55278ef5fe92

      Controllable synthesis of a non-interpenetrating microporous metal-organic framework based on octahedral cage-like building units for highly efficient reversible adsorption of iodine
      He, Wen-Wen; Li, Shun-Li; Yang, Guang-Sheng; Lan, Ya-Qian; Su, Zhong-Min; Fu, Qiang
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2012), 48 (80), 10001-10003CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A novel non-interpenetrating metal-org. framework IFMC-15 was successfully constructed based on octahedral cage-like building units and its outstanding performance in reversible adsorption of iodine was investigated. Solvothermal reaction of biphenyl-3,4',5-tricarboxylic acid (H3BPTC), 1,4-Benzenedicarboxylic acid (H2BDC) and Zn(NO3)2 in DMF produced the non-interpenetrating MOF IFMC-15, [NH2(CH3)2]·[Zn4O(BPTC)2(BDC)0.5]·8DMF based on octahedral cages. Single crystal x-ray anal. revealed that IFMC-15 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/c. The asym. unit contains one Zn4(μ4-O) cluster consisting of four Zn cations, one μ4-O atom, two deprotonated BPTC3- and 1/2 deprotonated BDC2- ligands. Rapid/reversible adsorption of iodine by IFMC-15 is demonstrated. Elec. cond./photoluminescence/fluorescence properties of IFMC-15 with/without encapsulated iodine/lanthanide is reported.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XhtlCjs77O&md5=8e98589d922d5d32999682beb0d81017
      (c) Lim, C.-S.; Schnobrich, J. K.; Wong-Foy, A. G.; Matzger, A. J. Inorg. Chem. 2010, 49, 5271– 5275 DOI: 10.1021/ic100378p

      23c
      Metal-Dependent Phase Selection in Coordination Polymers Derived from a C2v-Symmetric Tricarboxylate
      Lim, Choong-Sun; Schnobrich, Jennifer K.; Wong-Foy, Antek G.; Matzger, Adam J.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2010), 49 (11), 5271-5275CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Reacting biphenyl-3,4',5-tricarboxylic acid (H3BHTC) with the appropriate metal salt yields the microporous coordination polymers (MCPs) Mn3(BHTC)2 (1), Mg3(BHTC)2 (2), and Co3(BHTC)2 (3) contg. hourglass metal clusters. The addn. of Cu to reactions with CoII, FeIII, or MnII leads to the formation of heterobimetallic UMCM-150 isostructural analogs Co1Cu2(BHTC)2 (4), Fe1Cu2(BHTC)2 (5), and Mn1Cu2(BHTC)2 (6) contg. both paddlewheel and trinuclear metal clusters. X-ray diffraction anal. of the crystals of the heterobimetallic MCPs suggests that Cu on the trinuclear site of UMCM-150 was replaced by the other metal, whereas Cu in paddlewheel sites remains unchanged. N2 sorption isotherms were measured for the mixed-metal UMCM-150 analogs, and it was confirmed that there is no structural collapse after the metal replacement.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Porous Crystal Derived from a Tricarboxylate Linker with Two Distinct Binding Motifs
      Wong-Foy, Antek G.; Lebel, Olivier; Matzger, Adam J.
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129 (51), 15740-15741CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      The use of a reduced symmetry org. linker for the prepn. of porous coordination polymers is demonstrated. The solvothermal reaction of the unsym. substituted biaryl compd. biphenyl-3,4',5-tricarboxylic acid with Cu(II) ions produces a [3,4,6]-connected coordination polymer exhibiting very high porosity and surface area (SLangmuir = 3100 m2/g). A striking feature of the structure is its incorporation, in a single material, of both the ubiquitous dinuclear Cu(II) paddlewheel motif and the rarely obsd. trinuclear Cu(II) cluster. Satn. H2 uptake, measured at 77 K, shows an excess gravimetric uptake of 5.7% at 45 bar with a steep rise at low pressures.

CdTMPyP cations encapsulated in an anionic Cd(II) carboxylate framework, [Cd6(BPT)4Cl4(H2O)4]. Porph@MOM-10 is a versatile platform that undergoes exchange with manganese and copper to serve as the parent of porph@MOMs, Mnporph@MOM-10-Mn, [Mn6(BPT)4Cl4(MeOH)4][Mn(TMPyP)]·Cl and Cuporph@MOM-10-CdCu, [Cu4Cd2(BPT)4Cl4(H2O)4][Cu(TMPyP)], that exhibit permanent porosity and heterogeneous catalytic activity for epoxidn. of trans-stilbene. All three porph@MOMs were characterized by x-ray crystallog.

      A europium(III) based metal-organic framework: bifunctional properties related to sensing and electronic conductivity
      Hao, Zhaomin; Yang, Guocheng; Song, Xuezhi; Zhu, Min; Meng, Xing; Zhao, Shuna; Song, Shuyan; Zhang, Hongjie
      Journal of Materials Chemistry A: Materials for Energy and Sustainability (2014), 2 (1), 237-244CODEN: JMCAET; ISSN:2050-7496. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The accessible interspace of [Eu4(BPT)4(DMF)2(H2O)8] (EuL; BPT = biphenyl-3,4',5-tricarboxylate) metal-org. framework (MOF) based host materials can serve as good candidates for loading of a variety of guest mols. In this regard, two functional properties, sensing and electronic cond. of EuL MOF were systematically studied in this contribution. The photoluminescent properties reveal that the EuL exhibits characteristic red emission of Eu3+ ion, and presents highly detectable luminescence responses for Cu2+ ions and acetone mols. in DMF soln. For the studies of elec. properties, they were focused on the electronic conductivities of I2-incorporated EuL in anhyd. media and at different temps. With the increase of temp. from 25 to 80°, the I2-incorporated EuL showed significant changes in conductivities from 8.27 × 10-7 S cm-1 to 2.71 × 10-5 S cm-1. Meanwhile, the activation energy (Ea) was for the first time estd. for iodine-element-incorporated MOF with the help of Arrhenius plots. The successful achievements of the impedance measurements and analyses for I2-incorporated EuL prove that iodine-element-incorporated MOF can also be used for studies of cond. under anhyd. conditions and at moderate temp.

      26a
      Unique Chiral Interpenetrating d-f Heterometallic MOFs as Luminescent Sensors
      Wu, Zhi-Lei; Dong, Jie; Ni, Wei-Yan; Zhang, Bo-Wen; Cui, Jian-Zhong; Zhao, Bin
      Inorganic Chemistry (2015), 54 (11), 5266-5272CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      One novel three-dimensional (3D) 3d-4f metal-org. framework (MOF), [TbZn(L)(CO3)2(H2O)]n (1) [HL = 4'-(4-carboxyphenyl)-2,2':6',2''-terpyridine], was successfully synthesized and structurally characterized. Structural anal. shows that compd. 1 features a unique chiral interpenetrating 3-dimensional framework for the 1st time. The resulting crystals of 1 are composed of enantiomers 1a (P41) and 1b (P43), as was clearly confirmed by the crystal structure and the corresponding CD analyses of eight randomly selected crystals. The studies on CD spectra based on every single crystal clearly assigned the Cotton effect signals. The powder x-ray diffraction measurement of 1 after being immersed in common solvents reveals that 1 possess excellent solvent stability. Also, luminescent studies imply that 1 displays highly selective luminescent sensing of aldehydes, such as formol, acetaldehyde, and propanal.

      Lanthanide Organic Framework as a Regenerable Luminescent Probe for Fe3+
      Xu, Hang; Hu, Huan-Cheng; Cao, Chun-Shuai; Zhao, Bin
      Inorganic Chemistry (2015), 54 (10), 4585-4587CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      A unique three-dimensional Tb-BTB framework {[Tb(BTB)(DMF).1.5DMF.2.5H2O]}n (1, H3BTB (2) = benzene-1,3,5-tribenzoic acid, DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) types of one-dimensional channels was obtained and structurally characterized, exhibiting high thermal stability. Luminescent studies reveal that 1 can detect Fe3+ with relatively high sensitivity and selectivity. Importantly, 1 as the luminescent probe of Fe3+ can be simply and quickly regenerated, which represents a rare example in reported luminescent sensors of Fe3+.

      A novel 3D Eu-BTB framework (1) contg. 3 types of 1D channels was synthesized and structurally characterized. Compd. 1 exhibits high thermostability and water stability within pH range 2-12.       [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      27a
      A Mixed-Crystal Lanthanide Zeolite-like Metal-Organic Framework as a Fluorescent Indicator for Lysophosphatidic Acid, a Cancer Biomarker
      Zhang, Shi-Yuan; Shi, Wei; Cheng, Peng; Zaworotko, Michael J.
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2015), 137 (38), 12203-12206CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      Two lanthanide zeolite-like metal-org. frameworks (Ln-ZMOFs) with rho topol., Tb-ZMOF and Eu-ZMOF, were constructed by self-assembly of a 4-connected lanthanide mol. building block and a bipyridine-dicarboxylate ligand. Varying the Tb3+ and Eu3+ ratio during synthesis afforded three mixed-crystal isostructural MZMOFs with variable Eu:Tb stoichiometry. Fluorescence studies revealed that a methanol suspension of one of these mixed crystals, MZMOF-3, exhibits selective detection of lysophosphatidic acid (LPA), a biomarker for ovarian cancer and other gynecol. cancers. Linear correlation between the integrated fluorescence intensity and the concn. of LPA was obsd., enabling quant. anal. of LPA in physiol. relevant ranges (1.4-43.3 μM). MZMOF-3 therefore has the potential to act as a self-referencing and self-calibrating fluorescent indicator for LPA.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2MXhsVygsrrL&md5=0b3fe959ae64f97e3cd48b04fa5fca26

      27b
      Experimental Studies and Mechanism Analysis of High-Sensitivity Luminescent Sensing of Pollutional Small Molecules and Ions in Ln4O4 Cluster Based Microporous Metal-Organic Frameworks
      Zhou, Jing-Min; Shi, Wei; Li, Hui-Min; Li, Han; Cheng, Peng
      Journal of Physical Chemistry C (2014), 118 (1), 416-426CODEN: JPCCCK; ISSN:1932-7447. (American Chemical Society)
      Two new isostructural 3-dimensional lanthanide metal-org. frameworks (Ln-MOFs) {[Ln4(μ3-OH)4(BPDC)3(BPDCA)0.5(H2O)6]ClO4·5H2O}n (Ln = Tb (1) and Gd (2), BPDC2- = 3,3'-dicarboxylate-2,2'-dipyridine anion and BPDCA2- = biphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylate anion) based on cubane-shaped [Ln4(μ3-OH)4]8+ clusters were successfully synthesized and fully characterized. There are two kinds of micropores with dimensions of 3.0 × 7.0 Å2 along the b-axis and 4.5 × 5.5 Å2 along the c-axis in the cationic framework. Ln-MOF 1 exhibits an intensive green luminescence triggered by the efficient antenna effect of ligands under UV light. Luminescent studies illustrate that Ln-MOF 1 could be an efficient multifunctional luminescent material for high-sensitivity sensing of small org. mols., metal cations, and anions, esp. for benzene and acetone, Cu2+, and CrO42-. The mechanism of the sensing properties was studied in detail as well. Addnl., this cationic framework also displays fast capture of pollutant CrO42- by anion exchange.

      28
      Syntheses, Structures, and Luminescence Properties of a Series of LnIII-BaII Heterometal-Organic Frameworks
      Zhao, Xiao-Qing; Zuo, Ya; Gao, Dong-Liang; Zhao, Bin; Shi, Wei; Cheng, Peng
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (9), 3948-3957CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Ten novel LnIII-BaII heterometal-org. frameworks, {[Ln2Ba2(PDA)5(H2O)12]·mH2O}n (Ln = Pr (1, m = 9); Sm (2, m = 6); PDA = pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic anion), {[LnBa1.5(PDA)3(H2O)8]·2H2O}n (Ln = Eu (3); Gd (4); Tb (5)), {[Ln4Ba6(PDA)12(H2O)x]·mH2O}n (Ln = Dy (6, x = 27.5, m = 12); Lu (7, x = 27, m = 11.5)), {[Eu4Ba4(PDA)10(H2O)23]·16H2O}n (3a), {[TbBa3(PDA)4(NO3)(H2O)6]·2H2O}n (5a), and {[DyBa1.5(PDA)3(H2O)7]·2H2O}n (6a), were successfully synthesized under hydrothermal conditions, and the various structures are constructed from 1-dimensional chain, 2-dimensional layer, to CPE 3-dimensional framework. Compds. 1 and 2 exhibit 1-dimensional ribbonlike structures. Compds. 3-5 display 2-dimensional layers constructed by 1-dimensional BaII chains and [Ln(PDA)3] units. Compds. 6 and 7 exhibit complicated 2-dimensional structures different from those of 3-5. When the amt. of Ba(OH)2 changes during the syntheses of 3, 5, and 6, three novel coordination polymers 3a, 5a, and 6a were obtained. Compd. 3a consists of a 1-dimensional chain different from those in 1 and 2. Compd. 5a displays a 3-dimensional framework, which was constructed through the 2-dimensional Ba layers and [Tb(PDA)3] linkers. Compd. 6a is isostructural to those of 3-5, although synthetic conditions are different from each other. The significant differences in structure from 1 to 7, and from 3a to 6a, may result from the lanthanide contraction effect, whereas the structural divergences between 3 and 3a, 5 and 5a, and 6 and 6a originate from different amts. of Ba(OH)2 in the synthetic process. The luminescence studies of 2, 3, 5, 6, 3a, 5a, and 6a were applied in the solid state at room temp., showing intense characteristic emission bands of lanthanide ions, and PDA ligand as an antenna may effectively sensitize the luminescence of lanthanide ions.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Synthesis and Characterization of a 3D Coordination Polymer Based on Trinuclear Triangular CuII as Secondary Building Units
      Ding, Bin; Yi, Long; Cheng, Peng; Liao, Dai-Zheng; Yan, Shi-Ping
      Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (15), 5799-5803CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The hydrothermal reaction of CuII salts with 1,2,4-triazole (Htrz) in aq. NH3 yielded a novel metal-org. framework {[Cu3(μ3-O)(μ3-trz)3(OH)(H2O)6]}n (1), which was characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, x-ray powder diffraction, TGA, IR, and variable-temp. magnetic susceptibility. It crystallizes in cubic, space group Fd‾3c with a 24.644(3) Å, and Z = 96. Its framework is the 1st 3-dimensional structure using coordinative interactions constructed via trinuclear triangular CuII secondary building units, in which both CuII ions and trz ligands act as three-connected nodes to form a 6.82 net. An overall antiferromagnetic behavior was found in the compd.

      29c
      Structural Variations Influenced by Ligand Conformation and Counteranions in Copper(II) Complexes with Flexible Bis-Triazole Ligand
      Ding, Bin; Liu, Yuan-Yuan; Huang, Yong-Quan; Shi, Wei; Cheng, Peng; Liao, Dai-Zheng; Yan, Shi-Ping
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (1), 593-601CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Using a flexible bis-triazole ligand 1,4-bis(triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L), four new copper(II) compds. {[Cu(trans-L)(cis-L)2(H2O)2](CF3SO3)2·4H2O}n (1), {[Cu(cis-L)2(H2O)2](CF3SO3)2·2H2O}n (2), {[Cu(trans-L)2]Cl2}n (3), and {[Cu(trans-L)(cis-L)](BF4)2}n (4) were isolated. Conformations of L in 1-4 can be tuned as a result of changing the anion or metal/ligand ratio in the reaction system, which ultimately form novel framework structures varying from 1-dimensional to 3-dimensional with different supramol. architectures. 1 Is a 1-dimensional single-chain structure, in which trinuclear water clusters link adjacent triflate anions to form 1-dimensional supramol. helix. 2 Is composed of right-helical Cu(II) bis-triazole chains, which are interlinked via copper(II) ions as hingers forming a novel 2-dimensional layered structure. Eight-member supramol. cycles constructed by coordinated water mols. and free triflate anions are embedded into the 2-dimensional planes of 2. 3 Contains 2-dimensional planar nanogrid networks stacked in an AB stacking fashion. Triple Cl···H-C hydrogen bonds reside between these 2-dimensional layers. 4 Is a 3-dimensional MOF with large 1-dimensional rhombic channels with dimensionalities of 10.102 x 14.067 Å2 accommodating BF4- anions, which also represents the 1st case of metal bis-triazole compd. with CdSO4 topol. For 1-4, FTIR and elemental anal. was carried out, and the conformational variation of L also was briefly discussed.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhsVGnsLbE&md5=2ddaf7e4bcd87bb31297aded1775ac37
      (d) Wang, H. F.; Li, Y.; Wu, Y. Y.; He, Y.; Yan, X. P. Chem. - Eur. J. 2010, 16, 12988– 12994 DOI: 10.1002/chem.201001093

      29d
      Ascorbic Acid Induced Enhancement of Room Temperature Phosphorescence of Sodium Tripolyphosphate-Capped Mn-Doped ZnS Quantum Dots: Mechanism and Bioprobe Applications
      Wang, He-Fang; Li, Yan; Wu, Ye-Yu; He, Yu; Yan, Xiu-Ping
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2010), 16 (43), 12988-12994, S12988/1-S12988/9CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Although quantum dot (QD)-based room temp. phosphorescence (RTP) probes are promising for practical applications in complex matrixes such as environmental, food and biol. samples, current QD-based-RTP probes are not only quite limited but also exclusively based on the RTP quenching mechanism. Here the authors report an ascorbic acid (AA) induced phosphorescence enhancement of sodium tripolyphosphate-capped Mn-doped ZnS QDs, and its application for turn-on RTP detection. The chelating ability allows AA to ext. the Mn and Zn from the surface of the QDs and to generate more holes which are subsequently trapped by Mn2+, while the reducing property permits AA to reduce Mn3+ to Mn2+ in the excited state, thereby enhancing the excitation and orange emission of the QDs. The enhanced RTP intensity of the QDs increases linearly with the concn. of AA in the range of 0.05-0.8 μM. Thus, a QD-based RTP probe for AA is developed. The proposed QD-based turn-on RTP probe avoids tedious sample pretreatment, and offers good sensitivity and selectivity for AA in the presence of the main relevant metal ions and other mols. in biol. fluids. The limit of detection (3s) of the developed method is 9 nM AA, and the relative std. deviation is 4.8% for 11 replicate detections of 0.1 μM AA. The developed method is successfully applied to the anal. of real samples of human urine and plasma for AA with quant. recoveries from 96 to 105 %.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXhtlyhurzP&md5=98c79bfffd5c43eaa9499b6a9002d7e9
      (e) Ding, B.; Yang, P.; Liu, Y. Y.; Wang, Y.; Du, G. X. CrystEngComm 2013, 15, 2490– 2503 DOI: 10.1039/c3ce26998a
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      29e
      Hydrothermal syntheses and characterization of a series of luminescent Cd(II) frameworks with pyridine-based and benzene-based bis-triazole ligands
      Ding, Bin; Yang, Pan; Liu, Yuan Yuan; Wang, Ying; Du, Gui Xiang
      CrystEngComm (2013), 15 (13), 2490-2503CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Using the pyridine-based and benzene-based bis-triazole ligands 2,6-di-(1,2,4-triazole-4-yl)pyridine (L1, 9) and 1,4-di-(1,2,4-triazole-4-yl) benzene (L2, 10), a series of luminescent Cd(II) coordination polymers, namely, [Cd(μ2-L1)2I2]n (1), {[Cd3(μ3-L1)6](BF4)5(PF6)·18H2O}n (2), [Cd(μ2-L2)I2]n (3), [Cd(μ2-L2)(μ1,3-NCS)2]n (4), {[Cd(μ2-L2)(L2)(H2O)3]SiF6·3H2O}n (5), {[Cd(μ2-L2)(L2)(H2O)3]SiF6·CH3OH·2.5H2O}n (6), {[Cd(μ2-L2)3](BF4)2}n (7) and {[Cd(μ2-L2)3](ClO4)2}n (8), were isolated. 1 Represents a novel 2D framework contg. 1D infinite right- and left-handed helical chains. 2 Is a 3D coordination framework based on trinuclear Cd(II) clusters contg. triangular channels, in which eighteen free water mols., five free BF4- and one free PF6- anions are located. For 3, the L2 ligands can bridge CdII centers forming a 1D chain, while for 4 the L2 and μ1,3-NCS- co-ligands can further bridge CdII centers forming a 2D corrugated layer. 5 and 6 represent a novel coordination framework contg. 1D rhombic nano-porous channels, in which free SiF62- anions and free solvent mols. are located. 7 And 8 also represent a novel coordination framework contg. another kind of triangular nano-porous channel, in which free BF4- or ClO4- anions are located. Solid-state fluorescent spectra of 1-8 were detd. indicating strong fluorescent emission bands. Also L1 and L2 can adopt versatile coordination modes and have great potential in the construction of these highly-dimensional luminescent coordination frameworks.

      Syntheses, Structural Variation, and Characterization of a Series of Crystalline Coordination Compounds with 4-Benzene-1,2,4-triazole: Polymorph, Incomplete Spin Transition, and Single Crystal-to-Single Crystal Transformation
      Wu, Xiang Xia; Wang, You You; Yang, Pan; Xu, Yao Yao; Huo, Jian Zhong; Ding, Bin; Wang, Ying; Wang, Xiu Guang
      Crystal Growth & Design (2014), 14 (2), 477-490CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Based on the 4-substituted 1,2,4-triazole derivate ligand 4-benzene-1,2,4-triazole (L), cryst. coordination complexes varying from mononuclear to trinuclear species, namely, [Zn-(L)2-Br2] (1), [Zn-(L)2-Br2] (2), [Fe-(L)4-(NCS)2]2 (3), [Fe2-(μ2-L)3-(L)2-(NCS)4]·MeOH·CH3CH2-OH (4), [Fe2-(μ2-L)3-(L)2-(NCS)4]·2CH3CH2-OH (5), [Fe2-(μ2-L)3-(L)2-(NCS)4]·2CH3CH2-OH·1.5H2O (6), and [Ni3-(μ2-L)6-(L)4-(H2O)2]-(NO3)6·15.5H2O (7), were isolated. 1 And 2 present a temp.-induced polymorphic phenomenon of two Zn-(II) coordination complexes with L. The solvent effect plays the key role for the self-assembly of these Fe-(II) complexes 3-6: 3 contains mononuclear Fe-(L)4(NCS)2 units without spin-transition behavior, whereas both 4 and 5 present binuclear Fe-(II) complexes with three N1,N2-1,2,4-triazole bridges exhibiting incomplete spin-transition behavior. The low-temp. x-ray structural anal. (100 K) of 4 also confirms that one of the Fe-(II) centers is located at the low-spin (LS) state and the other Fe-(II) center is located at the high-spin (HS) state. When the binuclear Fe-(II) complex 5 was exposed in the H2O atm., solvent-induced single crystal-to-single crystal transformation can be obsd., and the binuclear Fe-(II) complex 6 exhibiting antiferromagnetic interactions can be isolated. Further, a trinuclear cryst. compd. is isolated when Ni-(II) salts were used to react with L. Variable-temp. magnetic susceptibility measurement (2-300 K) reveals antiferromagnetic interactions in 7. The polymorphic phenomenon (1 and 2), incomplete spin-transition phenomenon (4 and 5), and single crystal-to-single crystal transformation (from 5 to 6) also reveal great potential in the construction of these novel functional materials with L.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (g) Liu, J. Y.; Wang, Q.; Zhang, L. J.; Yuan, B.; Xu, Y. Y.; Zhang, X.; Zhao, C. Y.; Wang, D.; Yuan, Y.; Wang, Y.; Ding, B.; Zhao, X. J.; Yue, M. M. Inorg. Chem. 2014, 53, 5972– 5985 DOI: 10.1021/ic500183b

      29g
      Anion-Exchange and Anthracene-Encapsulation within Copper(II) and Manganese(II)-Triazole Metal-Organic Confined Space in a Single Crystal-to-Single Crystal Transformation Fashion
      Liu, Ju-Yan; Wang, Qian; Zhang, Li-Jun; Yuan, Bin; Xu, Yao-Yao; Zhang, Xin; Zhao, Cong-Ying; Wang, Dan; Yuan, Yue; Wang, Ying; Ding, Bin; Zhao, Xiao-Jun; Yue, Min Min
      Inorganic Chemistry (2014), 53 (12), 5972-5985CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      A new multidentate ligand 1-(9-(1H-1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)anthracen-10-yl)-1H-1,2,4-triazole (tatrz) was designed and synthesized. Using tatrz as a building block, three novel coordination frameworks, namely, {[Cu(tatrz)2(NO3)2]·(MeOH)·4H2O}n (1), {[Cu(tatrz)2(H2O)2](BF4)2}n (2), and [Mn(tatrz)2(SCN)2(MeOH)]·2H2O (3) can be isolated. Anion-exchange expt. indicates that NO3- anions in the two-dimensional (2D) Cu framework of 1 can be completely exchanged by ClO4- in an irreversible single crystal-to-single crystal (SC-SC) transformation fashion, as evidenced by the anion-exchange products of {[Cu(tatrz)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2·4MeOH} (1a). Further, if 1a was employed as a precursor in DMF, an isomorphic solvate of {[Cu(tatrz)2(DMF)2](ClO4)2·2H2O}n (1b) can be generated during the reversible dynamic transformation process. When 1 was immersed in MeOH, a distinct 2-dimensional layer {[Cu(tatrz)2(NO3)2]·4.4MeOH·0.6H2O}n (1c) was isolated. The solvent-exchange conversion is also invertible between 1 and 1c, which exhibits spongelike dynamic behavior with retention of cryst. integrity. If the 2-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional (3D) framework 2 is selected, it can be transformed into another 2-fold interpenetrating 3-dimensional framework {[Cu(tatrz)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2·5.56H2O}n (2a) in a reversible SC-SC transformation fashion. However, when the light yellow crystals of mononuclear complex 3 were exposed to trichloromethane contg. arom. org. anthracene (atan), through the authors' careful observation, the crystals of 3 were dissolved and reassembled into dark brown crystals of 2-dimensional cryst. coordination framework {[Mn(tatrz)2(SCN)2]·(atan)}n (3a). X-ray diffraction revealed that in 3a, atan acting as an org. template was encapsulated in the confined space of the 2-dimensional grid. Luminescent measurements illustrate that 3a is the 1st report of multidimensional polymers based on triazole derivs. as luminescent probes of Mg2+.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2cXos1Wlu7s%253D&md5=60d08e2dd480925dab044e775fb32163

      29h
      Hydrothermal syntheses of a series of cluster-based micro-porous luminescent cadmium(II) metal-organic frameworks with 4-amino-benzene-1,2,4-triazole: topological diversity, gas absorption and photo-luminescent characterization
      Xu, Yao Yao; Wu, Xiang Xia; Wang, You You; Su, Xiu Mei; Liu, Shi Xin; Zhu, Zhao Zhou; Ding, Bin; Wang, Ying; Huo, Jian Zhong; Du, Gui Xiang
      RSC Advances (2014), 4 (48), 25172-25182CODEN: RSCACL; ISSN:2046-2069. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      In this work the multi-dentate 4-amino-benzene-1,2,4-triazole (L1) ligand is used. A series of novel cluster-based micro-porous luminescent cadmium(II) frameworks, namely [Cd3(μ3-L1)2(μ2-L1)2(μ2-Cl)2Cl4]n (1), {[Cd2(μ3-L1)2(μ2-Br)2Br2]·1.05H2O}n (2) and {[Cd2(μ2-L1)3(L1)2(μ2-I)2]·(CdI4)·1.5H2O}n (3) have been isolated under hydrothermal conditions. 1 Presents a 4-connected (4,4) topol. using trinuclear Cd(II) clusters as basic nodes. For 1, two bridging μ2-Cl- anions and two bridging μ3-L1 ligands connect three neighboring CdII ions forming trinuclear Cd3 clusters. Each Cd3 cluster links four neighboring Cd3 clusters forming a 2D (two-dimensional) neutral micro-porous framework. 1D rhombic channels with dimensions of 7.594(2) Å × 21.250(6) Å can be obsd. along the c-axis. 2 Presents a rare I1O3 hybrid type micro-porous framework. In 2 these bridging μ3-L1 ligands link central CdII ions forming a 3D Cd-L1 org. connectivity. Two kinds of 1D Cd-Br-Cd inorg. connectivities further consolidate the 3D Cd-L1 org. connectivity, which ultimately forms a rare I1O3 type hybrid framework. 3 Presents a novel 3D cluster-based micro-porous cation framework contg. 1D channels, in which guest CdI42- anions and water mols. are located. Topol. anal. indicates that 3 presents a novel 4-connected dmp topol. using binuclear Cd2I2 clusters as basic nodes. PXRD, TGA and Gas absorption expts. for 1-3 have also been carried out. Solid state photo-luminescent spectra of 1-3 have been detd. indicating strong emission bands. For 1 selective photo-luminescent quenching for NO2- anions can be obsd. The result also reveals that L1 can adopt various different coordinated modes and flexible spatial distortion dihedral angles (between arom. benzene and triazole rings), which has great potential in the construction of these novel cluster-based micro-porous coordination frameworks.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2cXhtVansLrM&md5=b49afad95a5f72a332a50871a87d6e48
      (i) Ding, B.; Wang, Y. Y.; Liu, S. X.; Wu, X. X.; Zhu, Z. Z.; Huo, J. Z.; Liu, Y. Y. CrystEngComm 2015, 17, 5396– 5409 DOI: 10.1039/C5CE00724K
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      29i
      A series of multi-dimensional metal-organic frameworks with trans-4,4'-azo-1,2,4-triazole: polymorphism, guest induced single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation and solvatochromism
      Ding, Bin; Wang, You You; Liu, Shi Xin; Wu, Xiang Xia; Zhu, Zhao Zhou; Huo, Jian Zhong; Liu, Yuan Yuan
      CrystEngComm (2015), 17 (29), 5396-5409CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A flexible multi-dentate trans-4,4'-azo-1,2,4-triazole (atrz) ligand was employed to prep. novel coordination polymers, [Fe(μ-atrz)(NCS)2(H2O)2]n (1), [Fe(μ-atrz)(NCS)2(H2O)2]n (2), {[Fe(μ-atrz)(μ-Cl)(H2O)2]·Cl·H2O}n (3), {[Fe(μ-atrz)(atrz)2(H2O)2]·2Br·4H2O}n (4), {[Fe(μ-atrz)(atrz)2(H2O)2]·(BF4)2·2H2O}n (5), {[Cu(μ-atrz)3]·(BF4)2·2H2O}n (6), {[Cu(μ-atrz)3]·(BF4)2}n (7), {[Cu2(μ4-atrz)(μ2-OH)2(H2O)4]·SO4·3.75H2O}n (8), {[Zn(μ-atrz)(NCS)2]·0.5H2O}n (9) and {[Zn(μ-atrz)(NCS)2]}n (10). 1 And 2 present 1-dimensional polymorphic Fe(II)-triazole frameworks, in which a bicycle-pedal motion of the azo moieties of atrz can be obsd. Further, when different Fe(II) salts were used, 1-dimensional Fe(II)-triazole frameworks 3-5 with different 1-dimensional bridging motifs can be isolated. 6 Has a 3-dimensional nanoporous Cu(II) framework with dimensions of 11.709(1) Å × 12.201(1) Å. 6 Exhibits guest induced single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SC-SC) structural transformation to obtain another 3-dimensional nano-porous CuII framework 7 with dimensions of 11.621(6) Å × 16.674(1) Å. 8 Has a 2-dimensional cationic CuII framework constructed with infinite (CuO)n chains and unique μ4-bridging atrz ligands. Anion exchange expt. indicates an anion-induced structural transformation from the 3-dimensional CuII framework 6 to the 2-dimensional CuII framework 8 confirmed by PXRD patterns. Further, when Zn(NCS)2 was used in the reaction system, 9 can be isolated which exhibits guest induced SC-SC transformation to obtain 10 accompanied by a color change from red (9) to pale pink (10). Variable temp. magnetic susceptibility measurements (2-300 K) reveal antiferromagnetic interactions between central Fe(II) ions for 1-5. The polymorphic Fe(II) frameworks, guest induced single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation and solvatochromism also reveal great potential for the construction of flexible frameworks employing 4,4'-azo-1,2,4-triazole as basic building blocks.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2MXhtVynsLfI&md5=96f6eb9e4e631228d02a55672dedd3d8
      (j) Wang, Y.; Yuan, B.; Xu, Y. Y.; Wang, X. G.; Ding, B.; Zhao, X. J. Chem. - Eur. J. 2015, 21, 2107– 2116 DOI: 10.1002/chem.201404709
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      29j
      Turn-On Fluorescence and Unprecedented Encapsulation of Large Aromatic Molecules within a Manganese(II)-Triazole Metal-Organic Confined Space
      Wang, Ying; Yuan, Bin; Xu, Yao-Yao; Wang, Xiu-Guang; Ding, Bin; Zhao, Xiao-Jun
      Chemistry - A European Journal (2015), 21 (5), 2107-2116CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      For the purpose of investigating the coordination behavior of sterically congested alkenes and exploring the possibility of cofacial complexation in the polycyclic arom. system for the formation of extended polymeric networks, a new tetradentate ligand, 1,1,2,2-tetrakis[4-(1H-1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)phenyl]ethylene (TTPE), has been designed and synthesized. By using TTPE as a building block with regard to the self-assembly with MnCl2·4 H2O, a novel two-dimensional coordination framework {[Mn(TTPE)Cl2]·4CHCl3}n (1) can be isolated. Anion-exchange and org.-group-functionalized arom. guest TTPE-loaded host-guest complex exptl. results indicate that coordinated Cl- anions in the 2D framework of 1 can be completely replaced with dissociative ClO4- groups in an irreversible single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation fashion, as evidenced by the anion-exchange products of {[Mn(TTPE)(H2O)2](ClO4)2·0.5TTPE·5.25H2O}n (2). TTPE, acting as an org. template, was encapsulated in the confined space of the 2D grid of 2. To the best of the authors' knowledge, such large org. mols. encapsulated in the reactive org.-group-functionalized arom.-guest-loaded host-guest complex are unprecedented. Luminescence measurements illustrate that 1 and 2 represent novel examples of sensing materials based on triazole derivs. Further, 2 has been demonstrated by tuning the fluorescence response of porous metal-org. frameworks as a function of adsorbed small analytes.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2cXitVWhtr3E&md5=cad0e80e9930a6fda26a23b7063b71da
    30. 30
      Barnard, R. A.; Dutta, A.; Schnobrich, J. K.; Morrison, C. N.; Ahn, S.; Matzger, A. J. Chem. - Eur. J. 2015, 21, 5954– 5961 DOI: 10.1002/chem.201406332
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
